p: Unequivocally, there is a warming of planet Earth since the 1950s, with increased temperatures of the atmosphere and the oceans. The amount of ice and snow has diminished; sea levels have risen; and an increased frequency of extreme weather events, heat waves, drought, floods, storms are observed in parallel to an increase of the concentration of greenhouse gases (IPCC 2014). Climate change affects a large number of sectors. This means that integrated approaches and intersectoral collaboration are essential to face such challenges. The authors restrict this analysis to the added value of One Health approaches to adapt to health effects of climate change.
